intro: Aciphylla anomala, commonly known as the mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage that resembles a pincushion. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, typically from December to February. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is an important species in the ecological diversity of New Zealand's highland areas.
